If you feel like you are doing everything right, but there is still a communication breakdown on the other person's end, here are a few things you can do:

1. Pause and reassess: Take a moment to pause and reassess the situation. Try to understand why the other person might be having difficulty understanding you.

2. Check for distractions: Make sure there are no distractions that might be hindering communication. For example, if there is a lot of background noise, it may be difficult for the other person to hear you.

3. Use visual aids: Using visuals like charts, graphs, or diagrams can sometimes help to clarify your message.

4. Seek help from others: If you have a colleague who communicates well with the person in question, consider asking them to help mediate the conversation.

5. Be persistent: Sometimes it takes persistence to get your message across. If you believe you are right, don't give up on trying to get your point across.

6. Follow up: After the conversation, follow up with the other person in writing to confirm what you discussed and to ensure that they have understood your message.

Remember, communication breakdowns are a normal part of human interaction. Don't take it personally and don't get frustrated. Be patient and persistent in your efforts to communicate effectively.
